greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Continued fraction for Liouville's number (A012245).
comment: Except for the first term, the only values that occur in this sequence are 1,8,9,10,11,and values 10^((m-1)*m!)-1 for m > 1. The probability of occurrence P(a(n) = k) are given by:
reference: Harold M. Stark, "An Introduction to Number Theory," The MIT Press, Cambridge, MA and London, England, Eighth Printing, 1994, pages 172 - 177.
link: Muniru A Asiru, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..62
J. O. Shallit, Simple Continued Fractions for Some Irrational Numbers II, J. Number Theory 14 (1982), 228-231.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Liouville's Constant
Index entries for continued fractions for constants
formula: a(n) = 10 iff n = 8*m - 6 + 3*(m mod 2) for m > 0,
a(n) = 11 iff n = 8*m - 3 - 3*(m mod 2) for m > 0,
program: (PARI) { allocatemem(932245000); default(realprecision, 200000); x=contfrac(suminf(n=1, 1.0/10^n!)); for (n=1, 255, write("b058304.txt", n, " ", x[n])); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, May 15 2009
xref: Cf. A317413 (in base 2), A317414 (in base 3) A317661 (in base 4 and general).
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 08 2000
ext: Offset changed to 0 on the advice of _A.H.M. Smeets_ by _Muniru A Asiru_, Aug 11 2018
